III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section Program statement
Description (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation One staff member allows youth to smoke marijuana.
Investigation Interviews:
The Complainant was interviewed via telephone on July 18,
2025, and reported they had no additional information.
Youth A and Youth B were interviewed face to face at the
facility, separately, on July 21, 2025, in collaboration with
DHHS Worker. They both reported this information was the same
information DHHS Worker and I talked to them about for
investigation 2025SIC0000553. Youth A and Youth B denied
having any new information to report about seeing drugs or vapes
at the facility.
Director of Residential was interviewed face to face at the
facility on July 21, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Director of Residential denied being aware of any incidents or
allegations since the previous investigation (2025SIC0000553) of
staff or youth providing marijuana to any youth to smoke.
Youth C, Youth E, and Youth F were interviewed face to face
at the facility, separately, on July 29, 2025, in collaboration
with DHHS Worker. They all reported this information was the
same information DHHS Worker and I talked to them about for
investigation 2025SIC0000553. They all denied having any new
information to report about seeing drugs or vapes at the facility.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 29,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth D stated she
heard about an incident outside with a staff member and some
youth possibly smoking. Youth D described the incident that was
investigated in 2025SIC0000553. Youth D denied seeing any
staff member give or allow any youth to smoke marijuana.
Documents Reviewed:
• Special Investigation Report 2025SIC0000553 dated
05/27/2025. There was no rule violation regarding staff
2

providing marijuana to youths but there was a rule violation
for a staff member not locking her purse, containing a
nicotine vape pen in her vehicle, and a youth taking the
vape pen from the staff’s purse and the staff not telling the
administration.
• Eagle Village Staff Code of Conduct Policy. Policy states,
“Staff are prohibited from providing cigarette lighters,
cigarettes, vape pens, chewing tobacco, or any other
item/substance that is illegal for a minor to use or have in
their possession. If a staff uses any of these items
personally and they are brought to campus, staff shall keep
these belongings secure in a place such as locked in their
vehicles. Smoking and vaping are not allowed on our
campus.”
Analysis There were no findings regarding any staff providing marijuana to
youth and allowing the youth to smoke in investigation
2025SIC0000553 or in this investigation.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section Sufficiency of staff.
Description (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The youth in the facility are allowed to have sexual contact with
one another.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 21,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A reported
Staff 5 takes Youth D and Youth E on walks to the play structure
and allows them to kiss and touch each other. Youth A stated she
did not see Youth D and Youth E kiss and touch one another she
just heard about the incident from Youth D and Youth E. Youth A
denied seeing any youth have sexual contact with one another or
staff not supervising youth. Youth A reported Youth D and Youth
E only told Youth A about the one incident.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 21,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth B reported
3

Youth E told her Staff 5 took Youth D and Youth E for a walk to
the playground and allowed them “to do things” to each other.
Youth B would not provide further details regarding what “things”
meant. Youth B denied ever seeing Youth D, Youth E, or any
youth kissing or sexually touching one another. Youth B
described staff always supervising youth.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 29,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth C described
hearing a youth (could not recall who) say Youth D and Youth E
were “fingering each other” while on a walk. Youth C stated she
did not know what staff member was with Youth D and Youth E
when this may have occurred. Youth C reported she did not
believe it was true and thinks Youth D and Youth E are lying.
Youth C stated, “Staff are always watching us and paying
attention.”
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 29,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth D denied
ever kissing or sexually touching or being touched by Youth E or
any other youth while at the playground or on a walk. Youth D
denied being aware of any staff allowing youth to kiss or sexually
touch one another. Youth D reported she heard Youth C and
Youth F kissed. Youth D stated she did not see it happen but
heard about it. Youth D reported she could not recall who told her
Youth C and Youth F kissed, where it occurred or when. Youth D
stated she did not have concerns with staff supervising youth and
reported staff are always watching them [youth].
Youth E was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 29,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth E reported
kissing Youth D while at the playground with Staff 5. Youth E
described only the three of them being at the playground. Youth E
stated Staff 5 was on top of the play structure while Youth E and
Youth D were at the bottom of the play structure when Youth E
kissed Youth D. Youth E reported Staff 5 did not see them kiss.
Youth E denied Staff 5 allowing the kiss to occur or giving them
permission to kiss. Youth E stated all that occurred between
Youth E and Youth D was the kiss. Youth E denied being aware
of any staff allowing youth to kiss or sexually touch one another.
Youth F was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 29,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth F denied
being aware of staff allowing youth to kiss or touch one another.
Youth F stated she has never been on walks or to the playground
so she could kiss or sexually touch another youth or have a youth
4

kiss or sexually touch her. Youth F reported staff supervise and
closely watch all the youth.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 were interviewed face to face, separately,
at the facility on July 29, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS
Worker. They both denied being aware of any staff allowing
youth to kiss or sexually touch one another.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on July
29, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Supervisor
denied being aware of any staff member allowing youth to kiss or
sexually touch one another.
Staff 3, Staff 4, Staff 6, and Staff 7 were interviewed face to
face, separately, at the facility on August 6, 2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. All staff members denied
being aware of any staff allowing youth to kiss or sexually touch
one another.
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
6, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 5 described
taking different youths for walks around the campus and taking
youths to the playground. Staff 5 reported she has taken Youth D
and Youth E to the playground. Staff 5 stated she sat on a bench
watching them but could not hear them talking very well so she
moved to the top of the play structure to hear them better. Staff 5
denied allowing Youth D and Youth E to kiss or sexually touch one
another. Staff 5 denied seeing Youth D and Youth E kiss or
sexually touch one another. Staff 5 said she could hear Youth D
and Youth E talking the entire time with no long pauses indicating
they were doing anything inappropriate. Staff 5 reported she did
not have eyes on them the entire time as they were moving
around the play structure.
Documents Reviewed:
• Eagle Village Supervision of Residents Policy. Policy
outlines, “During awake hours, and especially during “down
time” or unstructured time, staff are to ensure that activities
are conducted with the youth. Staff must know at all times,
the whereabouts of those youth with whom they are
responsible. No youth is to be left unsupervised in any
activity or place for any extended time unless it has been
authorized as part of the treatment plan for a specific youth
(i.e., a youth who has shown responsibility and trust may be
recommended by a treatment team to be a messenger or to
walk back to a house from school, etc.).”
5

• Staff 5’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 5 completed supervision training in Academy on
10/02/2024.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews, staff are not allowing youth to kiss and sexually touch
one another.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142
Section Health services; policies and procedures.
Description (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(e) Dispensing medication.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The youth are over-medicated, and they get medications more
than once a day.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 21,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A reported
three different incidents when staff have forgotten to give Youth B
her noon medication. Youth A stated one time a staff member
(did not know who) did not sign off giving a youth (could not recall
what youth) their medication so a staff member gave the youth the
medication again. Youth A reported she believes staff have
forgotten her nighttime medication but also stated she has a hard
time remembering if she took her medication.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 21,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth B stated there
have been times when staff have forgotten her noon medication.
Youth B reported she could not recall when or how many times
that has occurred. Youth B denied being aware of any youth
being over-medicated or getting medications more than once a
day.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 29,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth C reported
having to take medication at 2pm and sometimes staff forgetting
to give her the medication. Youth C could not recall how many
times or when it has occurred. Youth C denied being aware of
any youth being over-medicated or getting medications more than
once a day.
6

Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 29,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth D described
not taking her 7pm medication one time because she was in the
shower and staff forgot to give it to her once she got out of the
shower. Youth D reported staff often forget to give Youth C her
2pm medication. Youth D denied being aware of any youth being
over-medicated or getting medication more than once a day.
Youth E and Youth F were interviewed face to face,
separately, at the facility on July 29, 2025, in collaboration
with DHHS Worker. They both reported being prescribed
medication and staff always giving them their medication. Youth E
and Youth F stated they could not recall any youth not getting their
medication or being over-medicated.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 29,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 2 stated there
have been a couple of incidents where a youth did not receive
their medication. Staff 2 reported there was one night she forgot
to give a youth her medication because the youth was in the
shower during med pass. Staff 2 described having to call a
supervisor, the nurse having to be notified and writing an incident
report. Staff 2 stated another time it was believed a youth’s
medication had been discontinued but hours later found out the
medication had not been discontinued.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on July
29, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Supervisor
denied being aware of any youth being over-medicated or getting
medication more than once a day. Supervisor stated there may
have been a time when a staff member forgot to give a youth
medication, but it is not a chronic issue.
Staff 3, Staff 4, Staff 6, and Staff 7 were interviewed face to
face, separately, at the facility on August 6, 2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. All staff denied any youth
being over-medicated or getting medication more than once a day.
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
6, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 5 stated
there was one time a youth did not receive their prescribed
medication because the youth was in the shower during med pass
and staff forgot to give the youth the medication when the youth
got out of the shower. Staff 5 denied youth being over-medicated
or getting medication more than once a day.
7

Documents Reviewed:
• There were only two medication related incidents
documented in extended reach from May 1 – July 29, 2025,
which are listed below. Incident reports are completed for
missed medication or if medication was given multiple
times.
• Eagle Village Incident Report dated 5/19/25 regarding
Youth A. Incident report consistent with Staff 2’s interview.
• Eagle Village Incident Report dated 5/31/25 regarding
Youth B. Incident report consistent with Staff 2’s interview.
• Eagle Village Protocol for Administering Medications and
Medication Errors Policy. Policy documents, “Eagle Village
(EV) will abide by applicable pharmacy laws regarding the
handling, storage, administration and disposal of all
medications prescribed for EV residents. Methodology
shall be in place to provide for documentation and data
collection during all phases of the medication pathway
which includes ordering, receiving, dispensing, and
administration of medication to residents.”
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as per youth and staff
interviews as well as documentation two youth did not receive
their prescribed medication. There were no findings of youth
being over-medicated or youth getting medications more than
once a day.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A staff member punched a youth after the youth hit the staff
member with a broom.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 21,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A described
Youth B getting a broom and trying to hit Staff 1. Youth A stated
8

Staff 1 punched Youth B in the shoulder or chest area and Staff 2,
Staff 3, and Staff 6 had to grab Staff 1 to get Staff 1 off Youth A.
Youth A denied being in the facility when this occurred because
she was on a walk with Staff 8 but stated Youth B told her about
the incident. Youth A reported she has never witnessed a staff
member hit a youth. Youth A denied ever being punched or hit by
any staff member.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 21,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth B described
being upset, picking up a broom in the kitchen and swinging it
around. Youth B reported Staff 1 took the broom and punched
Youth B in the chest area on her right side. Youth B stated Staff 2
and Staff 3 had to get Staff 1 off her. Youth B described being
placed in a restraint by Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 4, Staff 6 and Staff 7.
Youth B reported that four staff were holding her legs and two staff
were holding her arms. Youth B described Supervisor watching
the restraint and talking to Youth B telling her, her breathing was
okay. Youth B denied any youth being present. Youth B reported
this was the first time she had been hit/punched by a staff
member.
Youth C, Youth D, Youth E, and Youth F were interviewed
face to face, separately, at the facility on July 29, 2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. All the youth denied ever
seeing a staff member hit or punch any youth at the facility. All
the youth denied ever being hit or punched by any staff.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 29,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 described
Youth B being escalated because she was just told she dropped a
level. Staff 1 reported there were no other youth in the house
because staff were trying to de-escalate Youth B. Staff 1 stated
Youth B grabbed a broom that was in the kitchen, had the broom
raised over her head, yelling and threatening Staff 2. Staff 1
described being behind Youth B and attempting to take the broom
when Youth B turned around and started to come at Staff 1 saying
“Get the fuck off me.” Staff 1 reported Staff 3 got in front of Youth
B (between Youth B and Staff 1) and moved Staff 1 outside to the
front porch away from the situation. Staff 1 stated Youth B’s
anger was directed toward Staff 1 so leaving the situation was an
attempt to help calm Youth B. Staff 1 stated from outside she
could see Youth B was placed in a restraint by staff. Staff 1
reported she stayed on the porch outside until the restraint was
over. Staff 1 denied punching or hitting Youth B. Staff 1 denied
9

being escalated or upset. Staff 1 stated she does not know why
Youth B reported Staff 1 punched her.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 29,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 2 described
Youth B being escalated because the house was being “reset.”
Staff 2 stated Youth B grabbed a broom and was threatening staff.
Staff 2 reported Staff 1 grabbed the broom, Youth B went after
Staff 1 and Staff 3 was able to get between the two (Youth B and
Staff 1) and move Staff 1 outside because Youth B was targeting
Staff 1. Staff 2 reported Youth B ended up being restrained. Staff
2 described Staff 6 and Staff 7 holding Youth B’s arms while Staff
3, Staff 4 and herself held Youth B’s legs. Staff 2 denied seeing
Staff 1 punch or hit Youth B. Staff 2 denied Staff 1 said anything
to Youth B. Staff 2 stated, “nothing happened between Youth B
and Staff 1.” Staff 2 reported she did not have any concerns
about the restraint. Staff 2 stated there was in the moment of
coaching from Supervisor about staff positioning as Youth B was
moving around a lot and fighting the restraint. Staff 2 denied
anyone getting hurt.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on July
29, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Supervisor
described entering the house and Youth B was already on the
ground in a two-person level two extended restraint. Supervisor
reported Youth B was very escalated and fighting the restraint.
Supervisor stated staff at times were struggling to maintain the
restraint but were keeping Youth B and themselves safe.
Supervisor stated Youth B would try to lay flat on the floor but staff
would lean Youth B up to maintain the correct position.
Supervisor reported he could not recall what staff were involved in
the restraint. Supervisor described offering encouragement to
Youth B to calm down and staff regarding their positioning.
Supervisor denied ever seeing Staff 1 punch or hit any youth.
Supervisor stated he has not had any concerns with Staff 1’s
behavior with youth.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
6, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 3 described
Youth B as being escalated because Youth B was going down a
level in the program. Staff 3 stated Youth B grabbed a broom and
went after Staff 2 threatening Staff 2. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 was
behind Youth B and grabbed the broom. Staff 3 stated Youth B
turned around and grabbed Staff 1’s shirt. Staff 3 described
getting between Youth B and Staff 1 and moving Staff 1 outside to
10

remove Staff 1 as the target. Staff 3 reported going back inside
and Youth B was on the ground in a restraint. Staff 3 stated she
assisted on legs. Staff 3 described Youth B fighting the restraint,
kicking and trying to get out of the restraint. Staff 3 denied seeing
Staff 1 punch or hit Youth B. Staff 3 denied Staff 1 saying
anything negative to Youth B.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
6, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 4 described
Youth B as being escalated because she went down a level in the
program. Staff 4 reported Youth B was throwing items,
threatening staff, grabbed a broom and went after Staff 2 with the
broom. Staff 4 stated Staff 1 went to grab the broom from Youth
B, but Youth B turned around and went after Staff 1. Staff 4
reported Staff 3 took Staff 1 outside because Staff 1 was getting
assaulted by Youth B. Staff 4 stated Staff 1 went outside because
Youth B was targeting her. Staff 4 reported Youth B was placed in
a restraint. Staff 4 described holding Youth B’s legs during the
restraint. Staff 4 stated Youth B was kicking, telling staff she was
going to kill them and fighting staff. Staff 4 denied seeing Staff 1
punch or hit Youth B. Staff 4 denied hearing Staff 1 say anything
negative to Youth B.
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
6, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 5 stated she
was not present during the restraint. Staff 5 denied ever seeing
Staff 1 punch or hit any youth.
Staff 6 was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
6, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 6 described
Youth B as being upset because she moved down a level in the
program. Staff 6 reported Youth B was yelling, threatening staff
and grabbed a broom and went after Staff 2. Staff 6 stated Staff 1
grabbed the broom from behind Youth B and Youth B turned and
grabbed Staff 1’s shirt. Staff 6 reported Youth B was placed in a
restraint by herself and Staff 7. Staff 6 denied seeing Staff 1
punch or hit Youth B at any time. Staff 6 denied hearing Staff 1
say anything inappropriate to Youth B. Staff 6 stated Staff 1
removed herself from the situation and was not involved in the
restraint.
Staff 7 was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
6, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 7 described
Youth B as being upset, walking around breaking items in the
kitchen, threatening staff and grabbing a broom and going after
Staff 2. Staff 7 reported Staff 1 “snatched” the broom away and
11

Youth B turned around and hit Staff 1. Staff 7 stated Youth B had
a grip on Staff 1’s shirt and was trying to hit her again. Staff 7
described Staff 3 getting in between Youth B and Staff 1 and
moving Staff 1 away from the situation. Staff 7 reported Staff 6
assisted Staff 7 in placing Youth B in a restraint. Staff 7 stated
they [Staff 6 and Staff 7] held Youth B’s arms while Staff 2 and
Staff 3 held Youth B’s legs. Staff 7 reported Youth B was fighting
the restraint and continued to threaten staff. Staff 7 stated
Supervisor was supervising the restraint and was talking to staff
on how to hold Youth B and how to keep her positioned because
Youth B was fighting the restraint so much. Staff 7 denied ever
seeing Staff 1 punch or hit Youth B.
Video Review:
Video footage of Youth B from 7/16/2025 in the living room area
was reviewed with Director of Residential and DHHS Worker on
07/21/2025. Youth B is seen grabbing a broom in the kitchen,
walk toward Staff 1 holding the broom above her head and makes
a motion like she is going to hit Staff 1. Staff 2 comes behind
Youth B and attempts to take the broom away from Youth B.
Youth B turns around and grabs Staff 1 in the shoulder/chest area.
Staff 3 is seen coming up behind Staff 1, gets her separated from
Youth B and takes the broom. Staff 3 and Staff 1 are seen
walking away and out the door. Staff 1 is never seen punching or
hitting Youth B. Staff 6 and Staff 7 are seen initiating a restraint
on Youth B’s arms. Youth B drops to the floor and Staff 6 and
Staff 7 go into a level one safety position. Youth B is seen kicking,
forcefully moving back and forth and fighting the restraint. Staff 1
and Staff 4 assist by holding Youth B’s legs. Supervisor is seen
entering the house and walking to where the restraint is occurring.
Youth B continues to kick, forcefully move her body back and
forth, squirm, attempt to jerk her arms and at times move from the
seated position to her back while Staff 6 and Staff 7 reposition
themselves and their holds. Staff 1 is not involved in the restraint
at any time. There is no sound on the video.
Documents Reviewed:
• Eagle Village Behavior Support and Management Policy.
The policy documents, “It is the intent of Eagle Village to
treat all youth with dignity and respect, even when the
youth is being disruptive or inappropriate. For this reason,
some forms of discipline are deemed inappropriate and are
not approved. The following are examples of discipline
methods which are not to be used: Any type of corporal
punishment. Including but not limited to: hitting or striking,
12

throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth on any part of
their body.”
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 1 completed the required Aegis training on
6/13/2025.
• Incident Report dated 7/17/2025 from incident with Youth B
involving the broom and Staff 1. The incident report was
consistent with staff interviews as well as video review.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews and video review, Staff 1 did not punch Youth B.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff are being racist toward youth.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 21,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A described
staff being racist toward her because she is white. Youth A stated
it is all the staff at the facility not just one staff who is racist. Youth
A reported she gets in trouble more often because she is white.
Youth A stated she could not recall any examples of staff being
racist toward her.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 21,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth B reported
she feels staff are racist toward her because she is “black.” Youth
B stated she could not recall any interaction with staff as an
example. Youth B reported she feels she gets in trouble more
because she is “black.” Youth B stated she could not recall an
example.
Youth D, Youth E, and Youth F were interviewed face to face,
separately, at the facility on July 29, 2025, in collaboration
with DHHS Worker. All the youth denied having any concerns
13

with any staff being racist at the facility. All the youth reported
feeling staff treat all the youth the same. None of the youth
reported hearing any staff make a racist comment or statement to
any youth.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 were interviewed face to face, separately,
at the facility on July 29, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS
Worker. They both denied ever hearing a staff member be racist
toward a youth. Staff 2 reported youth say racist comments to
staff, but staff ignore the statements.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on July
29, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Supervisor
denied ever hearing any staff member make a racist remark or
statement to any youth. Supervisor reported no youth have come
to him to express concerns of any staff member being racist
toward them.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
6, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 3 denied
ever hearing any staff member make a racist remark or statement
to any youth. Staff 3 reported Youth A will say staff are being
racist when Youth A is held accountable for her behavior or told
she cannot do something. Staff 3 stated all the youth at the facility
are held accountable for their behaviors and actions.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
6, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 4 denied
ever hearing any staff member make a racist remark or statement
to any youth. Staff 4 reported when Youth B is not allowed to do
something because of her behavior, Youth B will say staff are
being racist. Staff 4 stated she did not have any concerns of any
staff being racists.
Staff 5, Staff 6, and Staff 7 were interviewed face to face,
